alt: Hannah Cockroft of Great Britain punches the air as she celebrates winning gold in the Women's 100m - T34 Final.  Her astonishing hand speed after a slow start saw her win by a margin of several chair lengths. She didn't break her own world record, but did set a new Paralympic record of 18.05 seconds.
caption: Hannah Cockroft of Great Britain punches the air as she celebrates winning gold in the Women's 100m - T34 Final. alt: Hannah Cockroft after winning gold
caption: She said after the race "I've been waiting for the last four years for that! It was a good race. I was kind of deciding whether to laugh or cry or what ... it's a kind of a surreal moment. It was absolutely amazing, everyone just went mental. On the start-line I knew I'd beaten all these girls before, I knew deep down I could do it and when there's so many people here supporting you, they kind of carry you along. As soon as that gun went off, the whole place just erupted."  Photograph: Tom Jenkins for the Guardian
